revised_title: Lunar Diurnal Magnetic Variations and Their Relation to Lunar Distance
tldr: The author investigates the lunar diurnal magnetic variations and their relationship with lunar distance. They find that the amplitude of the magnetic variation is inversely proportional to the cube of the lunar distance, supporting the tidal hypothesis. Additionally, the author discovers a remarkable phenomenon where the phase of the lunar magnetic variation at perigee is considerably in advance of that at apogee.
